content.text: Walking independently begins by walking around an object (cruising). With time the infant is gaining a sense of confidence in his walk because his sense of balance is improving with time and practice.
A balanced and stable walk is the basis for advanced movements like jumping, running and climbing.

If you are seeing that your baby has a hard time achieving the specific milestones described in the description or are at the age of 15 months and canâ€™t do those things you should consult with your pediatrician or an Infant development guide in order to learn how to help your baby to achieve these important abilities that are the foundation of their physical, sensory and emotional needs:
